title: Table of Values - Polynomial Function Graph

content.question: Which of the following could be true about the graph of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> on the interval <math alttext="3 less than x less than 7"> <mn>3</mn> <mo><</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo><</mo> <mn>7</mn> </math> ?

choices.label: The graph of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> is concave down because the function is decreasing, and the average rate of change over equal-length input-value intervals is increasing.
The graph of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> is concave up because the function is decreasing, and the average rate of change over equal-length input-value intervals is increasing.
The graph of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> is concave down because the function is decreasing, and the average rate of change over equal-length input-value intervals is decreasing.
The graph of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> is concave up because the function is decreasing, and the average rate of change over equal-length input-value intervals is decreasing.

content.answer: The graph of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> is concave down because the function is decreasing, and the average rate of change over equal-length input-value intervals is decreasing.

topic.text: 1.3: Rates of Change in Linear and Quadratic Functions

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Support conclusions or choices with a logical rationale or appropriate data.
